title: Are there under the table jobs in Canada? - Quora

response.answer_text: Under the table jobs are easy to find in certain industries. I’ve had an under the table (part time) job for the better part of 15 years. It pays good but it is not my main source of income I have a full time job and pay taxes.Under the table jobs are generally easier to find in small towns or rural areas … small businesses are generally happy for the extra help. Agriculture (planting and harvesting crops) and working with livestock are generally good areas to consider.Other people, like myself, have under the table side jobs. This could be house cleaning, dog walking, lawn care, pool cleaning or doing skilled work like carpentry or computer repairs for cash on the side.I’ve been audited four times in ten years and everything came back fine (no problems) because it is just side work and my on the book job pays my way.

There are, but if you try to earn a living that way both you and your employer will get far more problems than you ever could wish for. There are means and ways for Revenue Canada to find the “under the table jobs”. I wont tell “how” but only that they will… Don’t go there. Stay legal and pay your taxes. Besides, if you pay your taxes you will get CPP when that day arrives. That may make an enormous difference in your standard of living as a retiree. Are you thinking of becoming a non-documented immigrant? Not worth your effort, you will be found and deported quicker than you can say “WHAT the…
There are lots of under the table jobs across Canada, depending on the sector, if you looked hard enough, you can always find a cash job.
